text: Bottle. Dark ruby color with small white head. Aroma - Malts, coffee. Taste - Sweet, caramel, malts, spice.
Draught @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours unclear dark brown with a white head . Diacetyl - Thick toffee. Dark fruit and caramel.

Draught @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours dark brown with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light grass, light sourness, wood. Flavor is malty, caramel, wood, berries, grass. Medium body, soft carbonation. 280414

Tap at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Poured a hazy dark brown with long lasting off white head. The aroma is light sweet roasted malt. The flavour is medium sweet with a red berry fruit hop bitter smooth malt palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Dark beer with a creamy head. Nose is a little bit smoked and chocolate. Body is full, texture slick, carbon medium. Taste is sweet and bitter. Palate evokes very dark chocolate and ripe plums. Bitter aftertaste. PET from brewery , Dobrany , CZ , Malt,roasted,caramel,alcohol and fruity aroma , Dark brown color with smaller head , Sweet taste with longer finish , Full body , Soft carbon , Pretty good.
50cl bottle thanks to Joes. Hazy red-brown color, small off-white head. Smell and taste a foul, chemical sourness and infection. Finish is sour metallic and some bitterness. Yuk! Cant be intended.

Bottle @ home thx to joes. Hazy amber to orange colour with a bog off-white head. Smells rotten eggs, poo-ish, horseblanket.. Pretty weird smell. Tastes sourish, malty, some red fruits, pretty dull and a bit watery. Thin body, no carbo.

This is by far my favorite beer from this brewery.On tap at the brewery,pours Dark amber with a beige head,has a sweet and fruity aroma with notes of toffee,stone-fruits,sweet malt,candy sugar,alcohol and licorice.
Pours a dark amber red. Nice fruity head typical of Czech beers. Much more bitter then I thought it would be. Spicy, almost tannic in the way it dries your mouth. Slight hops on the nose.

draft.  brown body, fine bubbled off-white head. mild but exquisite nose of toasted grains, toasted rye bread and faint fruity esters. rich and toasty burnt cracker flavor with wonderful dryness and firmness, finishing with light cola / toffee  and barely-burnt crackers.

Bottle from brewery. Hazy dark amber color with huge frothy white head. Aroma of roasted grain, caramel. Taste, roasted malt, caramel, anise, hints of chocolate. Long bitter finish. I am not sure if its Dunkler bock, but beer is drinkable.

A - dark red color with amber tones, nice creamy head
S - sweet caramel, coffee and malt
T - bitter taste of caramel and toasted malts. 
M - medium to low carbonation with medium body. Important parts of the beer are on the very beginning and at the end. 
D - pretty drinkable, but with the little alcoholic end not too much
@ Zly Casy.  Light brown with a toasty aroma.  Toasty character.  Off-dry finish.  Nice breadcrusty malts.
Draft @ Zly Casy. Dark brown with thick head. Chocolate aroma. Creamy palate. Excellent compacted chocolate, fudgy flavors. Lingering mochachino but not too sweet. V. good.

Draft at the brewpub. A dark red-brown beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of malt, alcohol, and a lighter note of soy sauce. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, straw, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish, where the straw note lingers. A bit too alcoholic for my liking.

(tap at Zly Casy, Praha) this beer is very dark black with some red. It has a white foam with a tint of brown. The aroma is hoppy and a bit sour. Lots of hops and bitterness in taste and lots of roasted tones. I think my beer is oxidated, I felt lots of green apples but the others did not.
citrus, amber, red, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, average carbonation, long finish, thick feel,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap. Slightly hazy orangey golden with a creamy off-white head leaving some laces. Lightly perfumy hoppy nose also with caramel and alcohol. Quite full-bodied with very sweet roasted malt and caramel. Subdued bitterness. Quite solid. 280608

[on tap at brewpub]
Vanilla and hazelnut aroma with some notes of prune. Almost opaque, ruddy-black with a lasting tan sheet. Soda watery mocha flavour with good bitterness, though generally kind of boring. Medium body, moderate carbonation, tangy finish.
Dark brown with medium beige head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt, caramel and chocolate notes. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, caramel chokolade and coffee notes.

(6/23/08) Draught at Zlý Casy in Prague. Very dark brown, almost black-colored with a beige head. Aroma with lots of licorice and some maltiness. Sweetish flavor with salted licorice, some malt, a bit of caramel and toastiness. Medium-bodied. 6/4/6/3/12=3.1

(6/28/08) Draught at the brewpub in Dobrany. Dark brown with a beige head.  Aroma has some roastiness and hints of coffee and caramel. Sweet flavor with toasted malt, some sugariness and some caramel. Medium-bodied. 6/4/6/3/12=3.1
Draught at the brewpub - RBESG. Dark brwon - brown head. Alcoholic, sweetness, berries, wierd, toasted, caramel, light citric, hay.
From tap @ the brewpub. Dark brown in colour with a medium sized head. Malty with notes of toastedness, caramel, hay and hops.

Dark amber color, creamy beige head. Crisp, a bit lemony aroma. A bit caramelly too. Lightly caramelly flavor, quick finish. Nicely balanced.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a deep orange glare and a with a lacing tan head. Aroma is liqourice and roasted malt. Flavour starts fruity and roasted malt with a light spiced and liqourice flavour. Ends roasted and fruity with a growing bitterness into the finish.
Dark brown with a lasting off-white head. Malt aroma with toffee and biscuit. Sweet toffee flavour with some hops in the finish.

Draught at the brewpub. 
Red-brown colour, with creamy beige head. Grainy aroma, with caramel and ’darker malts’. Bit of berry vineous flavour with lots of residual sugars. Dark malts and a bit too apparent alcohol, with bitterness, but clearly not from hops, that are on low levels as expected.

Tap @ the brewpub.
Pours hazy redish black with a pretty, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma is sweet, slightly vinious and lots of caramel. But not too butterscotch’ish. Okay mouthfeel. Flavour is nice, though a bit too sugary sweet. Light caramel and good maltiness, though the hops are non-existent in the flavour.
Draught at the Brewpub. Black with ruby trim, tan head. Slight carbonation, sweet and fruity with a background herby note. A bit more mouthfeel than the rest. Caramel on the finish. Ok.
Draught at the brewpub during RBESG08.  Deep brown/ruby.  Again sweetish malt.  It’s alright, but just a tad sweet.  Some fruit.  Fine. But a tad syrupy maybe.

Draught at the brewpub. 
Dark amber coloured, small airy tan head, caramelly nose with touch of alcohol. Very malty, sweet caramelly and mild toffee taste with herbal hops in the moderate bitter finish.

Draught at the brewpub.  Cloudy mahogany colour, small head. Roasty aroma with coffee and molasses. Medium bodied with clean mouthfeel. Lots of caramel, notes of cherry coke. Salty finish with toffee and strawbery esters. Remains quite drinkable.

Tap at the brewpub during RBESG  Poured a darker cola like brown-red colour. A nice subtle malty nose, notes of raisins. The grainy-malty taste is good and sweetish, carrying some woodyish and almondy notes. Weak alcohol. Simple in a way and yet quite good.
Tap at the brewpub. Alround rating: Sweet roasty, candy sugar, caramel, herbal hop. Again not my style.

Draught at the brewpub during RBESG08. Dark brown with redish edge and a small beige head. Nice soft chocolate aroma with some fudge and and herbal hops. Meidum bodied and soft carbonation. Nicely balanced with a dry finish and moderate bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2008 First rating(Draught at Zlý Casy in Prague on June 23, 2008)Shady dark copper to brown color, creamy tan head. Salty licorice and sweet scent. Sweet, nettles, candy, salty taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Coffee aftertaste.7/4/5/3/12=3.1Rer<te(Draught at the brewpub, on June 28, 2008)Dark brown color, tan ehad. Sweet malty and licorice scent. Sweet malty, caramel and coffee taste. Medium mouthfeel and bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0

Deep ruby red colour, mediumsized beige head. Aroma is juniper, some sugary notes as well as sweet malts. Flavour is is strong salted licorice, some anise and caramelly malty. Surprisingly thin for being a bock.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at brewpub (Modrá Hvězda, Dobřany, Czech Republic)
The look: Dark amber body with a large creamy beige head
To me a typical Czech Polotmavé (Czech Amber Lagers) is: Hay and biscuit wrapped in caramel.  Very light fruity notes with no specific fruits giving the impression of slightly fruity caramel.  Moderately sweet.  Sweetness is well balanced by dry grassy hops.  Body is smooth.  Medium carbonation.
This one: (Not officially a Polotmavý but it was one to me).  As above with everything pushed a bit further.  Deeper caramel, omnipresent fruity notes, stronger hop presence.  An Imperial Polotmavý?

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréale grillée. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée voilée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale avec une pointe de cerise et de chocolat. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement torréfié. (Rating #1661)

My Bottom Line:
This Dunkler Bock sends wondrously structured caramel and chocolate maltiness to dally with elevating herbal hops. Yet another fascinating strong lager from Modra Hvezda.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-That usual alluring Czech tower of foam bobs atop the black cherry cloudiness.
-The body on this one is gorgeously suave and rotund.
-Malt sweetness lasts long after the sip is finished.
-A cranberry-like fruitiness serves the malts very well.

On tap at the brewpub.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2012 on tap at the brewpub. hazy copper with a steady off-white head and nice lacing revealing itself as the glass empties itself. bready aroma, hints of red berry, lightly grassy, some caramel sweetness and a chewy, grassy finish. fresh and quite bitter, more quality stuff from this village brewpub. Every time I go back to dobrany this beer stands out from their large line-up

On tap at the brewpub: Hazy, deep chestnut-amber coloured, off-white stable foamy layer; caramelly-roastmalty nose with a hoppy and a yeasty touch; rather full bodied, solid sweet-bitter flavour; distinctive sweet-caramelly, but also aromatic-bitter finish with a wave of yeast in the aftertaste. Well balanced, quite good Bock.........
